title: Holy shit Aatrox feels AWFUL.
body:
His kit doesn't correspond with itself like it should. Q is wonky, E is wonky, Q->E is wonky, players just walk away from you, players just walk out of your w even when they dont have boots, cannot get ontop of players as a bruiser for some reason, you're a useless sack of shit after you revive from your ult, half the time you get like 200-300 health after your revive because players just kill you so damn quickly, passive is useless as shit, E barely gives any healing from abilities, even when maxed second, forced to build damage because you're useless otherwise. I don't know why I would pick Aatrox over anything else to be honest. I can barely kill the damn intermediate bots for fucks sake.

Also, before someone gives me the "all new champions riot releases are bad for a while" argument, I can tell Aatrox sucks just from his kit alone. His numbers aren't the problem, it's his abilities and how they tie in with one another.

replies.body:
Again. 2 weeks, then give your views.

EDIT: Told you.

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-06-27T14:04:46.282+0000)
>
> Again. 2 weeks, then give your views.

I know when a champions kit sucks dick, Ornn was ass on release but that's because his numbers were terrible. His kit wasn't the issue, it was the fact that Riot didn't give him the stats that he needed. The thing about Aatrox is that even if they buffed him, players would just walk away from him because he has no hard CC to lock them in place to land his combo reliably.

You keep saying you "know when a kit doesn't work." But you have yet to give any reasoning as to why, aside from "q is wonky." Which is the most vague complaint you could give. 

LeBlanc's kit sucks because her Ethereal Chain is wonky.

Rammus is a bad champion because the interaction between his q and e is wonky.

Gnar is thrash because his jump is wonky.

Bad descriptor.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Midnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2018-06-27T14:28:35.156+0000)
>
> You keep saying you "know when a kit doesn't work." But you have yet to give any reasoning as to why, aside from "q is wonky." Which is the most vague complaint you could give. 
> 
> LeBlanc's kit sucks because her Ethereal Chain is wonky.
> 
> Rammus is a bad champion because the interaction between his q and e is wonky.
> 
> Gnar is thrash because his jump is wonky.
> 
> Bad descriptor.

So you're defending the point that you think his kit is perfectly fine?

Did you read my comment? 

I haven't played new Aatrox yet. I have no way of defending his kit. 

I said you aren't describing anything so I have no way of knowing whether you know what you are talking about.

His kit is pretty bad because his individual Q abilities don't synergize well at all, using the first ability is fine, but the second really doesn't have a place there.  His E is supposed to position for the 3rd Q proc into knockup.  But it's range isn't good enough. Any champ with moderate mobility will just walk or dash away from it.  And the lack of area on all his skills and how they work make him virtually unusable in teamfights.  Yes, let me just line up this champion-sized square on one person amidst this clusterf*ck of people all spamming their abilities.  His kit is too clunky and has reaaaally poor self-synergy.

Thank you Lhostalis. An explanation as to what is wrong with the kit is all I wanted. But OP tried to tell me what my opinion is, when I don't even have one yet.

Literally just told them "wonky" is a bad descriptor. Lol.

Ill give you a reason why. His Q is the ONLY way he kills anyone. Its BORING and EASILY avoided.

His entire new stupid kit is all about just landing Qs. Fucking BORING.
You mean...more boring than.....rightclicking on someone till they die?

It was never about right clicking until someone dies. You had to sometimes engage targets that you didn't want iin order to heal as you navigate through a team fight. You had to know when to dive the back lane, when to start a fight. You had to keep track of your stacks so that you could have any passive benefit when you need it, or else you wont even revive. You make it sound so simple. It was much more complex and interesting that you give it credit for, and certain not as lame as deleted a champion by pressing R.

And you're oversimplifying new aatrox's kit too.  These skills you've developed on him cd definitely weren't apparent on the day of release.  There's a ton of micro involved with bringing the most out of this champ, and you'll have to accept that you will be garbage with him for a while.

Why do you even think micro was even needed on Aatrox?
He was loved because he was a diver that can duel and build tank. It was never about rightclicking nor jiggling your mouse in a hundred directions.

youre supposed to use your e to reposition during the q when they walk out of it.

tbh it was less the time for the ability, but more the change in range that threw me off. without much practise, its kindof hard to predict the distance to position yourself for the second q, even when the target doesnt move.

the first q is the only one that feels reasonable, and that i managed to hit regularly in my test games.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-06-27T13:37:19.377+0000)
>
> youre supposed to use your e to reposition during the q when they walk out of it.
> 
> tbh it was less the time for the ability, but more the change in range that threw me off. without much practise, its kindof hard to predict the distance to position yourself for the second q, even when the target doesnt move.
> 
> the first q is the only one that feels reasonable, and that i managed to hit regularly in my test games.

I know it's meant to reposition, but that doesn't change the fact that every champion in the game that was released after 2014 has some sort of movement ability in their kit.

I'm also having problems even killing intermediate bots because they just run out of my abilities.

> [{quoted}](name=Freevageeter,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-06-27T13:41:43.355+0000)
>
> I know it's meant to reposition, but that doesn't change the fact that every champion in the game that was released after 2014 has some sort of movement ability in their kit.
> 
> I'm also having problems even killing intermediate bots because they just run out of my abilities.

i think the real problem is that his q forces you to stay at a distance with your opponent.

like its supposed to help you get into melee range by hitting the knockups. but what if you already ARE in melee range? then the ability is garbage, because the first two casts of the q are too far out.

you cant properly auto animation cancel with it like it would be intuitive. when i played him, i always tried to auto, q, auto, q, auto, q to maximize my damage, because thats intuitive on most champions.

but since the hitboxes work at a distance, it doesnt really work and your q does shit for damage.

maybe one way to fix this would be by making aatrox next auto attack gain extra range when he hits the enemy in the target area.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2018-06-27T13:44:38.778+0000)
>
> i think the real problem is that his q forces you to stay at a distance with your opponent.
> 
> like its supposed to help you get into melee range by hitting the knockups. but what if you already ARE in melee range?
> 
> you cant properly auto animation cancel with it like it would be intuitive. when i played him, i always tried to auto, q, auto, q, auto, q to maximize my damage, because thats intuitive on most champions.
> 
> but since the hitboxes work at a distance, it doesnt really work.
> 
> maybe one way to fix this would be by making aatrox next auto attack gain extra range when he hits the enemy in the target area.

Replying to the "auto q auto q" thing, yeah he attacks REALLY slow. Like it's an entire ability animation on it's own, that's how slow it is.

> [{quoted}](name=Freevageeter,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2018-06-27T13:50:58.264+0000)
>
> Replying to the "auto q auto q" thing, yeah he attacks REALLY slow. Like it's an entire ability animation on it's own, that's how slow it is.

its not the problem that its slow, its the problem that it just doesnt work in the first place.

because either youre hitting enemies with your q and they are out of auto attack range for the first and second hit.

or you have enemies in auto attack range to do it, but your first and second q hitboxes are too far out and dont have a chance to hit your opponent.

your q is made in a way where youre supposed to use successive hits to get in melee range of your opponent. but once youre there, then what? you cant use it to fight **in melee** on your next rotation.

its not like darius who can walk up, then w, walk back to q, and then hook you back in.
I haven’t played him yet, but something tells me that his Q is going to be a massive pain to land even with his E, especially since it relies on his E to move.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-06-27T13:40:26.745+0000)
>
> I haven’t played him yet, but something tells me that his Q is going to be a massive pain to land even with his E, especially since it relies on his E to move.

his first and third q are fine. the second is awkward.

the main issue i had with him is fighting an enemy thats already in melee range, where aatrox should shine.

when youre already in melee, the first two hits of your q are worthless since the hitboxes are too far out. you would have to walk away from your enemy to hit them, which is completely weird and counterintuitive.

and its not even like darius q where you can move regularly during the animation. youd have to use the e mini dash backwards.

Since he is supposed to be a juggernaut he should atleast have decent base stats to still bully people out who get on top of him. 
Like darius who is "countered" by dodging his "long" range Q and getting close but he still beats you in a longer fight due to his innate base stats. 
Aatrox stats are pretty meh even bad so to say especilly early on.

I can't really share a lot of these complains but i have yet to get him in a ranked game to properly tell something about him so i won't do that but still i cannot see how aatrox is able to do anything against renek, jax, riven, camille, fiora who just jump on him.

-From an elegant wise gentleman to russian psychopath
-From a skilled swordsman with banner wings to a classical buff devilman
-From an epic unique 3 splitted sword to generic giant one
-From an autoattacker to a spell caster
-From a Diver to a Juggernaut
-also lore change

i waited years...for this?

Please give him more than half a day before you critic him so harshly.
He might very well be garbage but it's literally his day of release and he isnt exactly simple to play.

Dont create another ornn.
Played him on the pbe too, still saying it, Clunky

If the new Aatrox was released as Darkin #4 without removing the old Aatrox, there wouldn't be much of a problem.

The kit has potential, but it just isn't Aatrox.

Aatrox plays like shit now. I can't imagine the aatrox mains are happy. He can't do anything he use to be able to.

He's lumbering, immobile, is kited easily, his combo takes forever to execute.

Worst of all his ultimate is complete and utter garbage. Instead of having a great passive for a second shot at life, your ultimate is wasted on that and it doesn't even function properly. You are unable to do anything after you revive, and in order to even revive at full health you have to stay alive for 10 seconds AND the enemy needs to be kind enough to kill you before you ult duration runs out instead of just kiting it out. Total shit.

I think you are having issues because his kit isn't an average brain dead kit anymore and requires timing and skill mastery to use. In order to play him effectively you will need to put in a large amount of time.

That being said, I think I'll skip ranked for the next week to avoid all the trolls playing  him day 1.

I don't know why you think the old aatrox was "average braindead". Managing his heal in lane was crucial, and since it wasn't a ridiculous heal? You could actually lose more hp than you gained trying to go in for it. Not to mention it requires autoattacking, which would push the wave by default unless you strictly last-hit, which would leave you with even less hp at the end of each wave. Simultaneously, you had to manage your blood well passive, which was generally stacked with blood price. Can't heal if you do it that way. Also gotta stay in combat so the stacks don't deplete, keep the wave AND your opponent in a good position where you can leap on them and either trade or kill them. Aatrox's Dark Flight was very buggy and could be interrupted on the rise-up but not on the collapse, would sometimes take you over walls and other times not, his E was inconsistent and using it for harass never worked since it'd mean pushing the wave, thus opening yourself to a gank. Old Aatrox was pretty mechanically intensive and a lot more than just "dive and attack lol durrr".

New Aatrox is thematically different, not even remotely similar mechanically, and in fact counterproductive to what his theme states him to be. His ultimate is Aatrocious and his revive ends the second the ult expires, and it's not a very long duration, all things considering. His E has not even half the range his Dark Flight has, and his initial two Q's require him to be far out of melee range for maximum damage - which is counterproductive to a melee duelist. Riven's 3-Q and Darius' outer-edge mechanic, only both of those abilities enable the champion to move instead of just stopping dead (without using another essential ability).

Did you just tell me that auto attacking isn't a brain dead kit functionality?  All you had to do with old aatrox was right click and press r. You must also be telling me that master yi and Tryndamere are high skillcap.

haha all you do for marksmen is right click and cast abilities
haha all you do for mages is right click and cast abilities
haha all you do in this Fucking game is right click and cast abilities. 

I literally just explained to you why Aatrox wasn't "brain dead right click LOL!" in a whole paragraph. You just don't want to be wrong.

As someone who tends to like juggernauts more than divers, new aatrox feels like a juggernaut with none of the power of a juggernaut but all the downsides. He is just too weak to make up for how easily he is to kite, and his ultimate is easily played around yet doesnt actually add much power compared with other juggernauts.
i wont be playing him anymore
28% win rate champ btw.

Old aatrox was played competitively
Doubt this new one will get that luxury

after 5 years of being completely ignored, damn what a fucking honor that the patch before his rework gets live he gets played competitive. Maybe if you wait another 5 years this aatrox will also play in comeptitive.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainAntiHeroz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=002c0000,timestamp=2018-06-28T02:54:48.342+0000)
>
> Old aatrox was played competitively
> Doubt this new one will get that luxury

He'll be lucky to even see gameplay in normal games unless they drastically overload his numbers like they did with Ornn and such. If they do that then that's less Aatrox being "good" and more Riot being incompetent and needlessly buffing him in areas he doesn't need it.

1st q needs a little more range and speed
W needs to be able to go through lane minions
E needs to be longer range or have a third charge, or both
R needs to hit max bloodwell faster and stay up for a while not hit the max hp you could get then turn off

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainAntiHeroz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tUcZhusT,comment-id=002c000000010000,timestamp=2018-06-28T14:39:07.659+0000)
>
> 1st q needs a little more range and speed
> W needs to be able to go through lane minions
> E needs to be longer range or have a third charge, or both
> R needs to hit max bloodwell faster and stay up for a while not hit the max hp you could get then turn off

I think he just needs to be able to walk and auto during Q animations and he would be awesome.

Aatrox's new kit seems counterintuitive to me.

To make use of his passive you want your target to be in close range of you, but to make best use of his Q you always want your target to be a certain distance away from you - so unless someone engages on you, you can rarely make good use of both his passive AND his Q.  Aatrox's new kit doesn't allow him to follow up against melee champions and ranged champions.  He lacks agency like Illaoi, has to position himself in a weird way (for a juggernaut) like Aurelion Sol, and his kit doesn't synergize that well with itself.

Whether or not Aatrox is a high skill cap champion that is secretly OP or not - his kit design seems (at least from my point of view) quite poor.

Well such a champ COULD NOT have released at a worse time.. The over buffed, mobile assassins rule this current "every thing explodes after 2 seconds of combat" meta, and they just counter his bruiser kit by nature. And If he can't nuke them back? He's gunna have a bad time. 

Maybe if this release is a collosal disaster it will force them to re-examine the state of the game.

I'm pretty sure memelord Hashinshin was right about this one. You can get better at landing your qs no matter how stiff they are, but even if you manage to land them all you still probably haven't killed whatever bruiser you're fighting against and you have no way of getting away from them since you burned all your e charges to land your abilities probably. In the laning phase at least he's just an easier to punish version of Riven.

Hey, you're making a mistake.
Aatrox is no longer a "bruiser", in the champion spotlight, is he called a "juggernaut". Like: morde or illaoi or mundo (i think the last one counts as one).

As such, try to not build only damage. Try to get 1 damage item such as: {{item:3078}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3071}}, and then full tank.
With emphasis on getting: {{item:3083}} and the 3000hp it requires to trigger.

While you are in your ult reviving stance, you are out of combat I believe, and that should eventually trigger the warmog's hp regen.
This reworked Aatrox has 3 knock-ups and a slow, which means, the more you stay alive, the more you disturb the enemy team. So, you staying alive (tank stats) are your main choice when building.

Also, Riot does this thing where, when they expect your character to build something, they give you less stats of it.
Example: 
mages end up having lower mana than adcs at max level. Because mages build mana, or better said, riot wants them too DEFINITELY build mana.
Shen has more AD than Zed, because Zed is expected to build AD.
And Zed has more armor than Shen, because Shen is expected to build armor. Even tho Shen is the tank, Zed, the assassin has more base armor than him.

That's riot's design philosophy.
Aatrox has very low hp, and meh hp and armor growth per level. So, you want to build hp and armor on him. As well as a damage item, most likely black cleaver as it synergies with {{item:3083}} 

Yes, I'm not playing the game but i like analyzing stuff.
Juggernaut with base HP under 2000 (worse than Vladimir)

don't know who downvoted both of us, but anyway

yes, that's because riot wants to force you to build tank stats, hp in particular
Darius, Illaoi, Garen build HP and have higher base HP.

They also don't heal for every point of damage they deal, unlike Aatrox. Darius only heals with the head of his Q, Illaoi only heals when her tentacles hit a champion and Garen only has his regen. Aatrox heals whenever he deals physical damage, and AFAIK he only has physical damage.

At least Aatrox's CC is consistent and have accurate hitboxes.

Shen's whole kit feels awful to use until you hit 1.4 attack speed, which shouldn't be a requirement on a tank.

But I can see how Aatrox players will be challenged to fight mobile top laners with such specific conditions needed.
Consistent? How can his CC be consistent if he can't land it ever.

Have you never seen the Shen E bugs?

It's actually embarrassing how often it happens. People on PBE when testing Pulsefire Shen encountered it more often than usual, and missed every taunt even though the hitbox landed on their enemy.

But alas, nobody plays Shen enough to see those bugs, so I guess no one cares.

shen's combo is relatively fluid and he has a lot of uses besides dealing damage in lane. most of his damage comes from autoattacking, and his q steroid has a low cd. i play my fair share of shen and ive never thought hit kit felt awful. 

aatrox is just clunky. he's not actually mobile, his 1st and 2nd q's are extremely difficult to land, and his e feels like a dead ability 90% of the time. the healing is negligible and the ult is NOT scary or particularly useful besides the revive; the old ult was very useful and gave a lot of stats. theres a delay between each q (he cant move while he casts them either, unlike darius or taric), and the hitboxes arent that big to begin with. he just doesnt feel particularly good to play as.

Melee champion with 0 threat in melee range

His base health is worse than Vladimir

His ultimate doesn't refresh in combat, meaning more than often does he ultimate NOT revive him in fights, which is fucking stupid.

Now do you feel my pain?
